Key Match Events: New Zealand skittle defending champions for 111 to win their first match against Australia in Australia since December 2011
Finn Allen's opening salvo - 42 off 16 balls - was full of explosive power and immediately put Australia on the back foot
In the chase, Australia lost their top three in the powerplay and there would be no way back for them
Santner dovetailed beautifully with Sodhi to pin down the middle order
Post-Match Reflections: Devon Conway, Player of the Match: Special performance from the boys. Credit has to go to Finn [Allen], he gave the momentum for us. It's pretty special and I've seen him do time and time again. He's a young guy and he's fearless. The way Finn plays complements my game and it was a good surface to bat on. I felt timing the ball would give me the best chance for success. Victory over Australia on any occasionÂ is a big up for us.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the first match of the Super 12s
New Zealand last beat Australia in Australia in December 2011. They've finally followed it up, 15 matches later, with a performance that maybe makes it all worth it
